name: Five Nights in Asriel's Cupboard
description:
This game has nothing to do with Undertale, I just threw a bunch of random fictional characters into a FNaF fangame I made.

This was originally made in scratch, so here's the scratch link in case this version doesn't work: https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/646852222 and here's the turbowarp link in case that one's laggy: https://turbowarp.org/646852222

Sorry for the 5-month wait, this game took longer to make than I expected. Also, jumpscares can now be switched off!

CONTROLS:

The gameplay mechanics are a lot like FNaF, so keep that in mind.

Everything is controlled by clicking things and hovering the mouse pointer over things.

-Use the cameras to look around the building.

-Drag the slider across the screen to look around on the cameras

-Use the BLUE buttons next to the doors to turn the lights on & off (unlike the demo, you toggle the lights, not hold them)

-Use the RED buttons next to the doors to open & close the doors (these buttons also toggle)

-Turn the desk fan on & off by clicking it, which can help for noise reduction and reduce power usage. Be warned though that if the fan is off for too long the heat will rise.

TIPS:

-Charlie is the only animatronic that moves on the first night, and he only goes to the left door, not the right.

-Garfield starts moving on night 2 and goes to the left and right doors, unlike Charlie

-Asriel starts moving on night 3 and has the same code as Charlie.

CREDITS:

Credits to Scott Cawthon (creator of FNaF) for inspiration and some of the sound effects.

-JXVI (me): Story, code, lore, and art

Asriel3333 (https://scratch.mit.edu/users/asriel3333/): Animatronic concept art, lore, beta testing, and inspiration for title and characters

DumbArtist (https://scratch.mit.edu/users/DumbArtist/): Warning screen, title screen, easter eggs, vector animatronic models

Opoids_ (https://scratch.mit.edu/users/Opoids_/): Debugging, easter eggs
